prerequisites: Prerequisite: One introductory science course from Biology, Chemistry, Geology or Physics; Concurrent registration in Geology 216L
summary: This course explores diverse topics of earth and environmental science in the context of Antarctica, a continent of extremes. Topics will include physical geography, ecology, geology and plate tectonics, oceanography, and paleoclimatology. We will also learn about the history of human exploration and research in Antarctica. This course will involve laboratories and field trips.
title: Antarctic Earth Science
